review: Several Apple TV community discussions complain that they can not navigate their iTunes menu on Apple TV.  The problem started at about the same time as the most recent ATV update.  A user's iTunes menu should be navigable on Apple TV when Home Sharing has been turned on.  Lately however many ATV customers have taken note that whenever they attempt this, Home Sharing crashes and an error report pops up on their Mac/PC.  Some users continue to play their itunes selections on ATV by navigating their iTunes menu on their Mac/PCs instead.  Home Sharing is less likely to crash under those circumstances.  Nevertheless, the problem returns whenever the user tries to navigate their iTunes menu on their Apple TV.  Users have expressed their frustration on ATV discussion threads, but there is no patch available nor any word from Apple as of this post.

author: Joseph Kennamer

review: I've noticed a lot of people are under the impression that this little box could single handedly replace their cable/sat subscription.  In most cases it probably won't.  It does not give you channels to watch at your leisure, but it will provide you with an easy to access and easy to navigate way to access plenty of online content such as itunes rentals, Netflix, video podcasts, Youtube, and Internet radio, plus a few others.But where this box really shines is when you pair it with another Apple device such as an iPad, iPhone or iPod Touch.  When running on the same network you are able to use "Airplay" to mirror your device onto your TV quite seamlessly and without wires.  Want to play your tunes on the nice speakers while you clean?  Easy.  Share your vacation pictures on the big screen with no fuss?  Simple.  You can even play games with the big screen, however depending on your network speed there is about a half second delay.I can't count how many times the music in our house has been pumped through the Apple TV.  Our TV system has the best speakers so it makes sense.Want to entertain the kiddos?  Airplay your ipad/iphone and turn on the video camera and let the kids have fun seeing themselves on TV.  Trust me, this entertains kids for quite some time.For the price, its a no-brainer.  It's not going to give you local channels, or replace all of the content you get with Satellite or cable but its a nice complimentary device for Apple users to take advantage of and at the $100 price you won't regret it.
